org.hibernate.search.query
Class ScrollableResultsImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.hibernate.search.query.ScrollableResultsImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.hibernate.ScrollableResults
public class ScrollableResultsImpl
extends Object
implements org.hibernate.ScrollableResults

Implements scollable and paginated resultsets. Contrary to query#iterate() or query#list(), this implementation is exposed to returned null objects (if the index is out of date).

+ * The following methods that change the value of 'current' will check + * and set its value to either 'afterLast' or 'beforeFirst' depending + * on direction. This is to prevent rogue values from setting it outside + * the boundaries of the results. + *

    + *
  • next()
    • + *
  • previous()
    • + *
  • scroll(i)
    • + *
  • last()
    • + *
  • first()
    • + *

Author:
Emmanuel Bernard, John Griffin

 boolean next()
          Increases cursor pointer by one.
 boolean previous()
          Decreases cursor pointer by one.
 boolean scroll(int i)
          Since we have to take into account that we can scroll any amount positive or negative, we perform the same tests that we performed in next() and previous().

Method Detail

next

public boolean next()
             throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
Increases cursor pointer by one. If this places it > max + 1 (afterLast) then set it to afterLast and return false.

Specified by:
next in interface org.hibernate.ScrollableResults
Returns:
booolean
Throws:
org.hibernate.HibernateException

previous

public boolean previous()
                 throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
Decreases cursor pointer by one. If this places it < first - 1 (beforeFirst) then set it to beforeFirst and return false.

Specified by:
previous in interface org.hibernate.ScrollableResults
Returns:
boolean
Throws:
org.hibernate.HibernateException

scroll

public boolean scroll(int i)
               throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
Since we have to take into account that we can scroll any amount positive or negative, we perform the same tests that we performed in next() and previous().

Specified by:
scroll in interface org.hibernate.ScrollableResults
Parameters:
i -
Returns:
boolean
Throws:
org.hibernate.HibernateException
